intro: Leavenworthia exigua, commonly known as the slender bladderpod, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. The plant is characterized by its small, showy white or pink flowers and its capsule-like seed pods. It typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and streambanks. Leavenworthia exigua is often found in disturbed soils and is considered a short-lived perennial.
